title: JoJo Siwa announces more Australian dates for her D.R.E.A.M tour
text:
JoJo Siwa has extended her January 2020 D.R.E.A.M tour in Australia.

The American Youtube sensation, 16, added extra dates due to overwhelming demand.

The announcement was made on Nickelodeon Australia's Instagram account on Friday.

'Yes you heard it right!' American YouTube sensation JoJo Siwa has announced more Australian dates to her D.R.E.A.M tour

It read: 'Yessssss you heard it right! @itsjojosiwa has announced MORE SHOWS IN AUSTRALIA our #exclusive Nick pre sale goes live THIS Friday!'

JoJo will now perform two shows in Brisbane (January 10 and 11), Sydney (January 13 and 14) and three concerts in Melbourne (January 16, 17 and 18).

The teen star first announced she would be heading Down Under back in September.

Taking to Instagram at the time, she wrote: 'AUSTRALIA!!!! I’m sooo excited my D.R.E.A.M tour is coming to Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane in January 2020!!!!'

JoJo's announcement comes as her first ever international tour is underway in America.

She launched her tour in May, and will also visit the UK and Ireland in November.

JoJo first visited Australia in 2018 and performed to 35,000 fans during the brief trip, which included attending the TV Week Logie awards.

Tour life: JoJo's announcement comes as her first ever international tour is underway in America. She launched her tour in May and will also visit the UK and Ireland in November

She's a performer: JoJo first visited Australia in 2018 and performed to 35,000 fans during the brief trip, which included attending the TV Week Logie awards

She rose to fame shortly after appearing on the second season of Abby's Ultimate Dance Competition in 2012.

The dancer later transitioned to Dance Moms between 2014 and 2015, and from there her popularity grew.

She is known for her colourful ensembles and bubbly persona, which has earned her more than 8.7 million Instagram fans and 10 million YouYube subscribers.

Dance queen! JoJo rose to fame shortly after appearing on the second season of Abby's Ultimate Dance Competition in 2012, as well as Dance Moms between 2014 and 2015

Earlier this year, JoJo made TIME magazine's 2019 list of most influential people on the internet.

She has also made a deal with children's network Nickelodeon and has launched a shoe line, clothing line, home decor range and her own toys.

Tickets for her Australia tour will go on sale from Friday, September 20 via Ticketek, while Nickelodeon pre-sale starts Friday, September 13.
description: JoJo Siwa has extended her January 2020 D.R.E.A.M tour in Australia.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
